title: Caustic
examples: She wrote a caustic report about the decisions that led to the crisis.

title: despair
ans: the feeling of no longer having any hope
examples: His despair nearly drove him mad.
She let out a cry of despair. [=desperation]
I was overcome by despair at being unable to find them.

title: Buttress
examples: The treaty will buttress the cause of peace.
The theory has been buttressed by the results of the experiment.

title: Ramparts
ans: a tall, thick stone or dirt wall that is built around a castle, town, etc., to protect it from attacks
examples: The city's ramparts crumbled long ago.
